page.title: 09Our Local Shop
page.content: 'Checkers' is our local shop and Post Office, run by Mr and Mrs Pearson. Nearly everyone in the village buys things there like newspapers, magazines and comics. I buy my weekly 'Beano' comic there. Mr Pearson always puts it in a safe place so it is not sold by mistake. They sell sweets, chocolates and icecream as well as groceries, vegetables and fruit. When we went to school camp our bus stopped outside and Mr Pearson and Mr Eley loaded all the week's food on it. At the Post Office our parents can buy stamps and postal orders as well as collect weekly allowances and State Pensions. In the summer many holiday-makers pass through on their way to explore Dartmoor and buy postcards at the shop. By Stuart Beck, age 9
